string.text: The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Precision adjustment and balancing of the trigger components allows for higher accuracy and reduced recoil.
Sawing off the barrel results in a much lighter and easier-to-handle weapon, but range and accuracy are impacted significantly.
Removing the majority of the stock makes the weapon considerably lighter and easier to handle, however recoil is much more pronounced.
Replacing the buttstock with a softer, padded alternative mitigates recoil slightly better.
Allows most Weaver-compatible optics to be mounted.
Replacing standard parts with analogs made of high-strength alloys increases the weapon's durability.
Rifling the barrel significantly improves accuracy and muzzle velocity, but prevents any further use of buckshot ammunition.
